On 13 November 2024, in San Javier, Chiapas, residents protested to demand the federal and state governments to address their demands. Participants were members of the Indigenous Xi'nich' organization and demanded justice after the massacre of five people that occurred on November 2006 in the town of Viejo Velasco. The event was held during an assembly.

On 13 November 2024, in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, a group of representatives from the municipality of Pantelho held a protest to demand the removal of their municipal council. The protesters argued that they do not know its members and that they have not presented themselves to the community. The participants held the event in front of the facilities of the Congress of Chiapas, stating that more than 60 communities have agreed to demand the removal of the current municipal council.
On 13 November 2024, in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, people held a protest and took over the Tax offices against bullfights.

On 13 November 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Tlalpan, approximately 50 residents of Santa Ursula Xitla blocked both directions of Avenida San Fernando to demand the immediate closure of a real estate development in the area to stop the felling of trees that is taking place within the property.
On 13 November 2024, in Guadalajara, Jalisco, family and friends protested outside Casa Jalisco to demand the location of a missing man since 7 November.

On 13 November 2024, in Zapopan, Jalisco, parents protested outside a primary school in Colonia Seattle to demand accountability for the management of school fees and the state of deterioration of classrooms and bathrooms.

On 13 November 2024, in Toluca de Lerdo, Mexico, residents of the San Diego Linares community blocked the Lerma-Valle de Bravo highway to denounce a multi-million dollar diversion of resources by the City Council for the construction of two streets in the community.

On 13 November 2024, in Cuernavaca, Morelos, a group of retirees of City Council protested in the center to demand the Credit Institute for Workers in the Service of the Government of the State of Morelos to recognize them as beneficiaries which would allow them to access benefits similar to active employees.

On 13 November 2024, in San Lorenzo Almecatla, Puebla, parents and residents of fraccionamiento Geo Villas San Jacinto blocked Avenida Arborada to protest against a monthly fee of 75 pesos demanded by the subdivision committee.

On 13 November 2024, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, students from the Instituto Tecnologico de Puebla (ITP) demonstrated and blocked Calzada Zaragoza to demand greater security and better conditions at the institution.

On 13 November 2024, in Zimapan, Hidalgo, more than 200 truck drivers from the Cement Union together with landowners from the San Pedro ejido protested to demand compensation from mining companies for the environmental damages caused to the ejido lands after companies expanded road lanes without proper permits.

On 12 November 2024, in Tijuana, Baja California, members of the Independent Health Workers Union (FINTRAS) blocked the 'Mano Amiga' bridge to protest against the lack of progress to solve the demands submitted months ago related to their labor conditions and pending payments.
On 12 November 2024, in Cabo San Lucas, Baja California Sur, around 50 people held a protest against the lack of water supply.

On 12 November 2024, in San Francisco de Campeche, Campeche, former employees of the City Council held a protest and prevented deputies from accessing the Congress. The protesters asked for clarification of the legal situation of a government official.

On 12 November 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, teachers members of the National Front of Upper Secondary Education Unions blocked all access to the Chamber of Deputies to demand compliance to their demands, including the payment of welfare measures and salary policy.

On 12 November 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, dozens of merchants gathered outside the central offices of the STC Metro to request a dialogue with authorities to present their cases against fraud. The participants pointed out that they bought slots that were still not given to them after three years of their purchase.

assoc_actor_1: MST: Social Movement for the Earth; PCM: Mexican Communist Party
notes: On 12 November 2024, in Torreon, Coahuila, members of organizations held a protest and announced the collection of signatures to demand the municipality do not privatize the public water company SIMAS Torreon. The participants were members of Laguna Soberana, Social Movement for the Land (MST) and Communist Party of Mexico (PCM).

On 12 November 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, for the second day in a row, vendors of craftwork from La Diana, Dalia, and Pueblito markets, and touristic workers from Barra Vieja, San Andres, and Lomas de Chapultepec affected by hurricane John held a press conference at Quebec square and then blocked Costera Miguel Aleman avenue to demand to be registered in a census and granted financial assistance.

On 12 November 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, workers of several organizations of tourist service providers in the Federal Maritime Land Zone (Zofemat) held a protest to demand financial support to the authorities after being affected by the lack of tourism in Acapulco.

On 12 November 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, teachers and parents of the 'Miguel Aleman Valdes' Kindergarten blocked Vicente Guerrero Boulevard to denounce that the National Guard intends to take over the street that connects this educational institution with the construction of the barracks in Colonia Postal.

On 12 November 2024, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, more than 100 workers and journalists from different media outlets stormed the plenary hall of the local Congress to demand respect for their work. The event was held after threats made by a local deputy, who over the weekend threatened to take legal action against reporters and media outlets that reported on the ride she took in a Tesla Cybertruck.

On 12 November 2024, in Mixquiahuala de Juarez, Hidalgo, friends and relatives of the police officers gathered and placed banners to claim justice for the officers accused to free two prisoners from a jail. The relatives claimed that the prisoners pointed a gun at the police officers and threatened them.
On 12 November 2024, in Tlajomulco de Zuniga, Jalisco, relatives and residents gathered to demand justice for a double femicide that occurred in Cuauhtemoc. The event was held during a funeral mass.

On 12 November 2024, in Santa Casilda, Michoacan de Ocampo, relatives of the victims of the accident that took place on the Siglo XXI highway in which five people died held a protest at the Santa Casilda toll booth demanding that the insurance company take responsibility for the expenses.

On 12 November 2024, in Jiutepec, Morelos, auxiliary authorities from various colonies gathered at the Tejalpa intersection as a protest against the non-payment of their compensations corresponding to the month of October. The city hall workers demanded the payment of their owed debts.

On 12 November 2024, in Hermosillo, Sonora, former workers and pensioners who are beneficiaries of the Institute of Social Security and Service for State Workers of Sonora (ISSSTESON) protested in front of the Government Palace against the deficiencies in the service and the lack of sensitivity by the authorities to improve the quality of medical care.

On 12 November 2024, in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, relatives of victims of the Mexican Army and the National Guard blocked the road leading to the World Trade International Bridge to demand justice for their relatives who were victims of actions committed by the federal authorities in charge of security on the border.
On 11 November 2024, in Mexicali, Baja California, employees of the Cultural Services Institute protested against labor harassment conducted by the Culture State woman Secretariat.

On 11 November 2024, in Tijuana, Baja California, parents of students of Tecnica Numero 1 Secondary School in Zona Rio protested in front of the premises of the Secretariat of Public Education to demand that the chemical waste accumulated in the laboratories be removed.
On 11 November 2024, in Tijuana, Baja California, parents of students took over the premises of Nueva Creacion secondary school in Colonia Las Margaritas to demand more teachers.

Around 11 November 2024 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, around 30 vendors protested in front of the offices of the Metro Collective Transportation System (STC) to demand more space for their stores.

Around 11 November 2024 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, around 500 members of the National Assembly of Electrical Energy Users (ANUEE) marched from the Red Building of the Federal Commission of Electricity (CFE) on 164 Reforma avenue, in Colonia Juarez, to the Federal Consumer Protection Agency (PROFECO) in Colonia Condesa, to demand lower electricity fares. The protestors blocked the intersection of Reforma and Insurgentes avenue during the march.

Around 11 November 2024 (as reported), in Tampico, Tamaulipas, relatives of fishers who disappeared aboard Roque Rojas 1 fishing boat off the coast of Matamoros protested in front of the captaincy of the port to demand that the authorities locate them. On 15 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, parents and teachers protested and blocked access to a kindergarten in Colonia Progreso to denounce the lack of a cleaning assistant at the school.

On 15 October 2024, in Mexicali, Baja California, teachers and members of the Union of Workers in Service of the College of Scientific Studies of Baja California (STSCECYTEBC) protested to demand salary increases and benefits for teachers as well as a meeting with authorities.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 15 October 2024, in Poza Rica de Hidalgo, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, feminists protested to demand the respect for the right to a life free of violence for children and women during the hearing of a man accused of child abuse.

source: El Sol de Hidalgo; La Silla Rota
notes: On 15 October 2024, in Pachuca de Soto, Hidalgo, neighbors protested and closed main roads to demand the lack of solutions to water services and shortages that have been ongoing for months.

On 15 October 2024, in Tijuana, Baja California, relatives and friends protested outside the State Attorney General's Office to demand compliance with the arrest warrant against a person responsible for the death of a security guard the month before.

On 15 October 2024, in Hermosillo, Sonora, residents protested outside the central officers of water services in the north of the city to demand authorities to provide solutions to ongoing water shortages.
On 15 October 2024, in Sabinas, Coahuila de Zaragoza, parents took over an elementary school to demand the withdrawal of a minor student accused of poor behavior and sexual assaults of classmates.

On 15 October 2024, in Saltillo, Coahuila de Zaragoza, a group of owners of foreign vehicles protested to demand the immediate delivery of their license plates from the state government, claiming delays despite having paid fees and received authorization.
On 15 October 2024, in Champoton, Campeche, family and friends protested to demand justice for a minor who was taken out of custody from his mother and demanded his immediate return.

On 15 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, for the second consecutive day, around 30 residents of San Agustin housing complex blocked the personal house of the woman mayor to demand the restoration of the electrical supply, which was impacted by hurricane John the month before.

source: La Jornada; La Prensa de Monclova
notes: On 15 October 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, between 150 and 200 workers, judges, lawyers and judicial officers from the Federal Judicial Branch (PFJ) demonstrated against the recent approval of the judicial reform and urged financial organizations to oppose it. Demonstrators knocked down metal fences surrounding the National Palace leading to pushes and struggles with police officers. One police officer sprayed a fire extinguisher on the demonstrators.

On 15 October 2024, in Morelia, Michoacan de Ocampo, at least 1500 normal rural students from Tiripetio, Arteaga and Morelia together with students of the National Autonomous University of Mexico and members of social organization demonstrated to demand the release of their two classmates arrested after they were shot by municipal police officers. Demonstrators left from Tiripetio and then marched to the historic center of the city and caused damage to the Legislative Branch with stones and fireworks and damaged traffic signs. Hundreds of students were arrested by police officers .

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 15 October 2024, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, dozens of employees of the Federal Judicial Branch (PJF) protested against the recent approval of the judicial reform and the popular election of several positions in the framework of the reform.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 15 October 2024, in San Cristobal, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents protested and blocked the Orizaba-Puebla highway at KM 269 against the poor conditions of streets and connecting roads in several municipalities. The blockade was lifted hours later upon negotiations.

On 14 October 2024, in San Martin Texmelucan de Labastida, Puebla, residents captured two men accused of theft at the market and beat them in attempted lynching. Police officers arrived at the scene and arrested both.

On 14 October 2024, in Tlapa de Comonfort, Guerrero, residents of four indigenous communities protested and blocked the Federal Electricity Commission (CFE) in Tlapa to demand electricity services in their communities.

On 14 October 2024, in Tampico, Tamaulipas, meat importers and employees of a slaughterhouse protested in the historic center against the director and demanded his dismissal accused of delays of the delivery of machinery and irregularities at the slaughterhouse.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 14 October 2024, in Veracruz, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, employees of the Judicial Branch protested outside a restaurant where the alternate senator was having lunch and called the PAN member a traitor for their support of the judicial reform.

On 14 October 2024, in Toluca de Lerdo, Mexico, merchants and members of the National Confederation of Social and Commercial Associations (Conasoc) protested at the Toluca bus terminal to demand the return of working spaces for them after they were evicted from their spaces weeks before.
On 14 October 2024, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, employees of the Federal Judicial Branch protested outside the General Hospital against the recently approved judicial reform.

On 14 October 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, around 250 employees of the Federal Judicial Branch (PJF) protested in the historic center at the Bankers Club, against judicial reform and warned that the proposed popular election of judges undermines the rule of law and urged financial organizations to oppose it.

On 14 October 2024, in San Francisco de Campeche, Campeche, employees and judges of the Judicial Branch and residents protested at the International Airport against the Judicial Reform and to demand that secondary laws ensure that the funds, trusts, mandates, and analogous contracts of the judicial system are not eliminated, as this could affect their wages.

On 14 October 2024, in Toluca de Lerdo, Mexico, a group of students from the Performing Arts of the Autonomous University of the State of Mexico (UAMEX) protested against the lack of repairs to potholes, lack of street lighting and security in the area close to the university.

On 14 October 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, widows of municipal police officers protested at City Hall to demand the reactivation of benefits and an annual increase as established by the trust which has remained frozen since its creation.
On 14 October 2024, in Puerta de San German, Guanajuato, mothers of a kindergarten protested to demand the dismissal of a teacher accused of psychological violence against children.
On 14 October 2024, in Altamira, Tamaulipas, parents protested and took over a high school to denounce aggressions of students and the lack of teachers at the school.

On 14 October 2024, in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, a group of people and victims of fraud protested at the government palace to denounce the company Aras and the illegal use of insured goods of the company by government officials.
On 14 October 2024, in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, residents of Colonia Jarachina Sur protested and closed roads in the neighborhood to denounce the lack of water services for several days.

On 14 October 2024, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, parents and teachers protested at a kinder garten to demand the intervention of government authorities to provide cleaning to the facilities after suffering damages caused by Hurricane John.

source: El Sol de Hidalgo; La Silla Rota
notes: On 14 October 2024, in Tula de Allende, Hidalgo, relatives of missing persons protested at the municipal Public Security Offices to demand the acceleration of investigations and the location of their missing relatives.

notes: On 14 October 2024, in Mequetla, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents protested and blocked unitos of the Pemex company to denounce the presence of the companies that cause damages to roads and to demand Pemex to allocate resources for work.

On 14 October 2024, in Monclova, Coahuila de Zaragoza, residents of Colonia Obrera Sur tercer sector protested against the invasion of street vendors in green areas of the city and to demand the eviction of the street vendors.

On 14 October 2024, in Ensenada, Baja California, a group of residents accompanied by their lawyer protested outside the State Attorney General's Office (FGE) in Colonia Bustamente in support of colleagues reported for the crime of dispossession by a real state agency.

On 14 October 2024, in Ciudad Santa Catarina, Nuevo Leon, three people protested and blocked roads in Colonia Mirador de la Huasteca to demand traffic operations in the area due to the high flow of vehicles passing through the neighborhood.

On 14 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, residents of San Agustin housing complex blocked the personal house of the woman mayor to demand the restoration of the electrical supply, which was impacted by hurricane John the month before.

On 14 October 2024, in Toluca de Lerdo, Mexico, around 100 students from the normal rural school Lazaro Cardenas del Rio demonstrated and caused damage to the offices of the Integrated Educational Service of the State of Mexico (SEIEM) and 18 cars and vans at the parking lot to demand compliance with their unknown demands.

On 14 October 2024, in Santa Cruz Atzcapotzaltongo, Mexico, students from Normal School of Teneria vandalized the offices of the Services of Integrated Education of Mexico State (SEIEM), causing damages to the premises and to 18 vehicles in its parking lot, to demand economic support and a change in their school's management team.

On 14 October 2024, in San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, members of the FPR of Chilon protested outside the Control Court and Trial Tribunal to demand the release of three environmental defenders who were unjustly arrested and imprisoned.

On 13 October 2024, in Morelia, Michoacan de Ocampo, residents of Colonia Presa de los Reyes attacked officers who arrived after receiving a report about gunshots in the neighborhood. Several men attacked police officers with stones and sticks and punctured a tire of the unit forcing the police officers to leave the area to avoid an escalation of violence.

On 13 October 2024, in Tiripetio, Michoacan, normalist students set fire to three vehicles near the Morelia-Patzcuaro highway, including a Morelia Police patrol car. The event arose when normalists stole vehicles. The police chased them. Later the normalists confronted the police and set a police patrol on fire. More students arrived and threw stones to the police. Two people were arrested and one of them was injured by the police with a gunshot.

On 13 October 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, a group of 65 clowns accompanied by motorcyclists marched on Alvaro Obregon Avenue towards La Lomita to protest against the violence that the state has been experiencing for the last two months. The protesters stated that these actions has left them without work.

On 13 October 2024, in Saltillo, Coahuila de Zaragoza, employees of the Federal Judicial Branch (PJF) protested and placed locks on the facilities against the Judicial Reform and to demand that secondary laws ensure that the funds, trusts, mandates, and analogous contracts of the judicial system are not eliminated, as this could affect their wages.

On 13 October 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Coyoacan, a group of activists and sex workers protested at the University Museum for Contemporary Art (MUAC) against an exhibition that is accused of the re-victimization and violation of sex workers.

On 13 October 2024, in Tiripetio, Michoacan, normalists students blocked the Patzcuaro-Morelia highway around Tiripetio to demand justice after their colleagues were injured during the event recorded hours before where three vehicles were stolen and set on fire by the normalists (coded separately).
On 13 October 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, five people held a protest against the attacks by the Israeli government against Palestine. The protesters asked for an end to the genocide.
On 13 October 2024, in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, people held a protest against animal abuses in Fraccionamiento Colinas del Sol.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 13 October 2024, in Poza Rica de Hidalgo, Veracruz, relatives of a young woman who disappeared asked for protection as they stated that police officers might be involved in the case. The relatives also asked state security authorities to continue the search of the woman.

On 13 October 2024, in Guadalajara, Jalisco, people held a protest against animal abuse.

source: El Sol de Hidalgo; La Jornada
notes: On 12 October 2024, in Atlalco, Hidalgo, indigenous residents detained and put in the community jail two councilwomen and one councilman, all three Morena members, who they accused of delivering food supplies intended for those affected by the flooding of the river to residents of other communities that were not affected. The event was recorded in video and shared on social media.

On 12 October 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, dozens of workers from the Federal Judicial Branch (PJF) held a protest outside the Senate of the Republic during the ordinary against the judicial reform.

source: El Sol de Sinaloa; La Jornada; Riodoce
notes: On 12 October 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, dozens of people gathered and held a car caravan demanding peace. This event comes after an increase of violence in the state in the last months.

Around 12 October 2024 (between 12 - 13 October), in Zacatecas, Zacatecas, students of the University Extension Language Program (PEUL) protested to demand that their shift on Saturdays is not discontinued.

On 11 October 2024, in Tijuana, Baja California, a group of mothers demonstrated in front of the building of the State Educational System to denounce the lack of three teachers at the 'Rolando Davis Verdugo' elementary school.

On 11 October 2024, in Tijuana, Baja California, dozens of garbage collector workers from private companies blocked the access to the municipal palace to demand that their demands be attended. The protesters are dissatisfied after they are being denied entry to the landfill in the eastern part of the city, where they dump the waste.

On 11 October 2024, in San Francisco de Campeche, Campeche, residents clashed with government worker during an eviction in Colonia Caracol after personnel from Urban Development arrived to remove palapas and makeshift houses in the mangrove area. The residents responded with stones and sticks.

On 11 October 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, hundreds of workers of the Judicial power held a demonstration at the headquarters of the Judiciary to demand another agreement that will allow them to extend the suspension of their work activities. The protesters claimed that there are no conditions for returning to work. This event was held after the deadline approved by the Federal Judicial Council (CJF) to restart work in all federal courts and tribunals finish.
On 11 October 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, more than 3000 members of ANUEE marched to demand a clean slate, electricity as a human right, and a fair social electricity rate.
On 11 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a group of Otis victims demonstrated outside the Naval Base to demand to be censused by Federal Welfare.

On 11 October 2024, in Barra Vieja, Guerrero, residents blocked the Lomas Chapultepec bridge to demand to the personnel of the Ministry of Welfare to take them into consideration for the census after they were affected by floods caused by Hurricane John.
On 11 October 2024, in Guadalajara, Jalisco, workers of the Federal Judicial Branch held a bilingual protest at the consulate of the United States against the approval of judicial reform.

On 11 October 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, around 40 residents of Colonia Industrial, mostly women, held a protest to accuse the police of arbitrarily shooting at their homes and other real estate.

On 11 October 2024, in San Juan Tlautla, Puebla, more than 100 parents from the Emiliano Zapata elementary school held and beaten up the janitor after accusing him of being the perpetrator of sexual abuse against at least three students. The parents also detained the school's director.
On 11 October 2024, in Victoria de Durango, Durango, animal defenders and rescuers along with civil society members marched against animal abuse. The protesters wanted to raise awareness.
On 10 October 2024, in Tijuana, Baja California, workers of the federal Judicial Branch blocked the expressway in Rio Tijuana to protest against the approval of the Judicial Refom.
On 10 October 2024, in Isla Arena, Campeche, residents protested against the Governor during her visit. The protesters claimed lack of support during the hurricane.

On 10 October 2024, in San Andres Larrainzar, Chiapas, a group of residents (indigenous community) tied up and punished a man who was accused to be a car thief in the area. The event was recorded in video and shared on social media. The man was hanged from a basketball court, blindfolded and left half-naked.

On 10 October 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Miguel Hidalgo, around 100 workers of the Judicial Branch of the Federation held a protest outside the Business Coordinating Council (CCE) to ask to open the door for them to participate in the Annual High Level Dialogue event of Companies of the United States and Mexico. The participants pointed out the necessity to for them to express their rejection against the Judicial reform.

On 10 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, around 20 people affected by the passage of hurricanes Otis and John marched on Cuauhtemoc Avenue towards La Diana to demand to be included in the delivery of aid after the damages suffered by hurricanes. Also, members of the Federation of Independent Divers and Fishermen Committees blocked Costera Miguel Aleman to demand to the federal government to be part of the support programs for those affected by hurricane 'John.'

source: Colima Noticias; El Norte; El Sol de Acapulco; Yucatan a la Mano
notes: On 10 October 2024, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, thousands of people including workers marched to demand justice for the killing of the municipal president recently killed. The protesters also demanded the dismissal of the Governor.

On 10 October 2024, in San Pedro Cholula, Puebla, a group of teachers, administrators, parents and students from the Industrial and Services Technology Studies Center (CETis) number 67 demonstrated to demand the dismissal of the school's director for workplace harassment and poor administrative management.

On 10 October 2024, in Morelia, Michoacan, pro-life (pro-vida) demonstrators gathered against the legalization of the abortion in the state. At the same time, feminist groups held a protest to support the legalization of the abortion. This event was held during the approval of the Reform in the state Congress.

On 10 October 2024, in Querendaro, Michoacan, people held a demonstration to demand the withdrawal of the Civil Guard from the region. The demonstration turned violent when the participants vandalized the City Hall. They also tried to burn a patrol car and damaged two others. The municipal police intervened and 14 people were arrested. According to local sources, this event was influenced by a criminal cell who used social media to organize the demonstration and threaten with violence.
On 10 October 2024, in Alamos Tepetitlan, Puebla, parents of the Ninos Heroes de Chapultepec secondary school took over the facilities to demand teachers for the institution.
On 10 October 2024, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, more than 100 beach vendors held a protest against the new Semarnat criteria. The protesters blocked Avenida del Mar and Avenida Rafael Buelna.

Around 9 October 2024 (as reported), in San Francisco de Campeche, Campeche, residents of Colonia San Jose blocked Montecristo street to demand the Federal Commission of Electricity (CFE) to restore the electrical supply in the area.

The residents semi-stripped the men, beat them, and forced them to carry bundles of avocados along the main avenue in the presence of municipal police officers. Some residents demanded that the men to be lynched and stated that they would not let the authorities take the detainees away. The town hall organized a security operation with state agents to prevent residents from taking the men.

On 9 October 2024, in Tepapayeca, Puebla, residents detained five suspected thieves and killed one of them. His body was burnt and left with the hands tied in the local zocalo. More than 500 residents blocked the accesses to the community. State and municipal police officers arrived to the town to negotiate the release of the other four men, which was denied by residents armed with sticks and tubes. According to a version, residents tied one of the remaining detainees to a post, and made two others be dragged by horses. 1 fatality.

On 9 October 2024, in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, four residents held a man and beat him up after he was accused to be a thief. The residents later also shot him. He died. Another person who was on site recorded the event on video and shared it on social media. 1 fatality.

On 2 October 2024, in Merida, Yucatan, workers and judges of the Judicial Branch of the Federation (PJF) protested to express their concerns about the recently approved judicial reform and its implications for the justice system, which is considered a threat to the independence and integrity of the Judicial Branch

notes: On 2 October 2024, in Texhuacan, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents of El Pedregal protested and closed the highway to Orizaba and retained four employees of the Federal Electricity Commission (CFE) to request the presence of directors and to demand the supply of electricity after constant blackouts.

source: El Norte; El Universal (Mexico); La Jornada
notes: On 2 October 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, 8000 people, including university students, Indigenous groups, and civil society organizations, demonstrated to commemorate the 56th anniversary of the student massacre and marched to the Zocalo of the city to demand justice and punishment of those involved in the student massacre in 1968. Demonstrators launched four explosives at police officers as well as at the metro station Tlatelolco and vandalized bus stops, government buildings, and bank windows. A group of around 150 masked people and members of the Black Block organization pulled the camera of a reporter to prevent him from filming and threw water in his face. Demonstrators set fire to the doors of City Hall and threw stones, rockets and explosive devices at the building. Police officers repelled the aggression and threw stones and activated fire extinguishers. Two members of the Black Bloc were injured as a result.

On 2 October 2024, in Tinguindin, Michoacan de Ocampo, dozens of members of the Purepecha Indigenous group of Tzirio demonstrated and blocked the Zamora-Los Reyes highway to demand the appearance of a day laborer after he disappeared while he was on his way to work. Demonstrators set fire to a vehicle during the demonstration.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Mexico (2018-); MC: Citizens' Movement; Students (Mexico)
source: 24 Horas (Mexico); Imagen del Golfo; Riodoce; Tabasco Hoy
notes: On 10 September 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, for the eighth consecutive day, hundreds of citizens, students, judges and employees of the Judiciary protested against the judicial reform. Protesters used tubes, fire-extinguishers and knives to force the doors of the Senate of the Republic and enter the building. Police officers used fire-extinguishing foam and water with soap to disperse the protesters. Inside, senators were holding a session on the reform, which was suspended and transferred to the Senate's alternative headquarters in Casona de Xicotencatl. Protesters headed to Casona, where a group of them assaulted a senator of the Citizens' Movement party by throwing gasoline into his eyes. Police officers intervened again, and suspectedly used tear gas and fire-extinguishing powder to disperse the protesters on Eje Central, Tacuba and 5 de Mayo streets. The Secretariat of Public Safety (SSC) later published a statement denying the use of tear gas. Also in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, students and members of the association 'Youth for Reform' protested in support of the judicial reform on Madrid street and Insurgentes avenue, a few meters from the demonstration against the reform, and around Casona de Xicotencatl on 5 de Mayo, Donceles, Tacuba and Republica de Cuba streets, where they blocked the access to senators. These protests are part of a national strike that includes protests in other cities (coded separately).

source: E-Consulta; El Proceso; El Siglo de Durango; Imagen del Golfo; La Silla Rota; MiMorelia
notes: On 5 September 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, for the third consecutive day, students, judges and employees of the Judiciary blocked the access to the Senate of the Republic on Insurgentes avenue and Madrid and Paris streets in Colonia Tabacalera, and the Senate's alternative headquarters in Xicotencatl, to demonstrate against the judicial reform. Some sources indicate that demonstrators intend to maintain the blockade until October, to prevent president-elect Claudia Sheinbaum from taking office. The demonstration was joined by people who marched in caravans from other states. Among the participants there were the president of the SCJN and the president of the PRI. On Madrid street, a group of people grabbed by the neck and beat at least three journalists, whom they blamed for blocking the access of senators from opposition parties. An alternative version indicates that, according to some demonstrators, infiltrated provocateurs might have promoted the clash.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 5 September 2024, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, law students of the Veracruzana University marched on Gonzalo Aguirre Beltran circuit to protest against the judicial reform. The protests are part of a national and indefinite strike that includes protests in other cities (coded separately).

The protest is part of a national and indefinite strike that includes protests in other cities (coded separately).
On 1 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, residents protested and held a rally to demand a reduction in the daily working hours from 48 hours to 40 hours.
